p: Lyme disease (LD) is the most common reportable vector-borne zoonosis in the United States, and its incidence has sharply increased over the last decade. The causative pathogen, spirochete B. burgdorferi, is transmitted to humans by a tick vector. The main vector of LD is I. scapularis in the northeastern and midwestern Unites States, and Ixodes pacificus in the Pacific Northwest [ 1].
